S.I. No. 281 of 2022 

VETERINARY COUNCIL OF IRELAND (RECOGNITION OF 
QUALIFICATIONS AND REGISTRATION OF VETERINARY NURSES) 
REGULATIONS 2022 

The Veterinary Council of Ireland, in exercise of the powers conferred on it 
by section 52 and section 133 of the Veterinary Practice Act 2005 (No. 22 of 
2005) (as amended), hereby makes the following regulations:- 

Part 1 

Preliminary 

Citation

title: ARRANGEMENT OF REGULATIONS
heading: 5. The register contains four parts:
text_raw:
5. The register contains four parts: 

Part A-Veterinary Nurses, registered pursuant to sections 95(1), 95(7), 
95A(1) and/or 96A; 

Part B- Veterinary Nurses granted provisional registration, registered 
pursuant to section 96; 

Part C-Veterinary Nurses permitted to provide services in the State on a 
temporary and occasional basis, registered pursuant to section 95(10) and/or 
95A(4); and 

Part D-Veterinary Nurses granted limited registration, registered pursuant to 
section 96B.
text_norm: 5 register contains four part part a-veterinary nurse registered pursuant section 95(1) 95(7) 95a(1) 96a part b- veterinary nurse granted provisional registration registered pursuant section 96 part c-veterinary nurse permitted provide service state temporary occasional basis registered pursuant section 95(10) 95a(4) part d-veterinary nurse granted limited registration registered pursuant section 96b

title: ARRANGEMENT OF REGULATIONS
heading: 6. The register shall contain in respect of each registered veterinary
text_raw:
6. The register shall contain in respect of each registered veterinary 

nurse, the following information: 

(a) Name;

(c) 

gender; 

(d) postal address, email address and telephone number(s) for 

correspondence; 

(e) 

registration number; 

(f) 

registration date; 

(g) 

(h) 

registration status (which may include particulars of any period 
of suspension from the register or any conditions attached to 
registration and compliance with such conditions); 

in the case of a veterinary nurse registered on Part C of the 
register the period for which the nurse is registered on Part C 
of the register; 

(i) 

in the case of a veterinary nurse registered on Part D of the 
register the period for which the nurse is registered; and 

(j) 

date of annual retention(s).

heading: 7. This Part applies to a veterinary nurse seeking to be registered in the
text_raw:
7. This Part applies to a veterinary nurse seeking to be registered in the 

register, other than— 

(a) 

(b)

title: ARRANGEMENT OF REGULATIONS
heading: 8. An applicant for registration as a veterinary nurse must satisfy the
text_raw:
8. An applicant for registration as a veterinary nurse must satisfy the 
Council that he or she has the requisite qualifications by providing evidence 
to the Council that he or she — 

(a) 

Is a person entitled to be registered under section 95(1) of the 
Act and has been awarded educational qualification(s) 

 
 
 
 
 6 [281] 

prescribed by the Council in the prescribed educational 
qualifications regulations; 

(b) 

(c) 

is a person entitled to be registered under section 95 (7) and/or 
the equivalent provisions in the regulations of 2017; 

is a person entitled to be registered under Section 95A(1) of 
the Act and/or the equivalent provisions in the regulations of 
2017; and/or 

(d) being a person who is not entitled to be registered under 
sections 95 or 95A, is a person pursuant to section 96A who 
has undergone programmes of training and education, passed 
examinations and obtained qualifications that are of a standard 
that is not lower than the standard of such programmes, 
examinations or qualifications that are, in the opinion of the 
Council, necessary for the practice of veterinary nursing in the 
State. In order that the Council may be satisfied that the 
standard that applies to the programmes of education and 
training undergone, examinations passed and qualifications 
obtained is not of a standard that is lower than the standard of 
such programmes, examinations or qualifications that is 
necessary for the practice of veterinary nursing, it may require 
an applicant, to sit and pass an examination set by or on behalf 
of the Council in that regard. 

Recognition of qualifications for the provision of services in the State on a 
temporary and occasional basis-Part C of the register

title: ARRANGEMENT OF REGULATIONS
heading: 10. In the case of an application for limited registration under section 96B
text_raw:
10. In the case of an application for limited registration under section 96B 

of the Act the applicant must satisfy the Council: 

(a) 

that the person making the application is required, in the case 
of an application under section 96B to participate in the 
provision of approved programmes of education or further 
education; and 

(b) 

that he or she has the requisite knowledge and skill for the 
purposes of section 96B. 

 
 
 
 [281] 7 

Manner and form of application for registration in Parts A and D of the 
register

title: ARRANGEMENT OF REGULATIONS
heading: 11. An application for registration in the register shall be made in such
text_raw:
11. An application for registration in the register shall be made in such 
manner and form, including by electronic means, as may be published by the 
Council from time to time, and shall include: 

(a) personal information in relation to the applicant, together with 
the appropriate evidence and or documentation as specified by 
the Council including: 

(i) 

first name(s) and surname(s); 

(ii) 

if applicable, any other name by which the applicant is 
known; 

(iii) 

date and place of birth; 

(iv) 

nationality; 

(v) 

gender; 

(vi) 

postal address for correspondence; 

(vii) 

email address for correspondence; 

(viii) contact telephone number(s); 

(ix) 

languages spoken; and 

(x) 

if applicable, place of work and position held. 

(b) details of qualifications, together with the appropriate evidence 

and or documentation as specified by the Council; 

(c) 

in the case of an application for limited registration: 

(i) 

evidence that the person making the application is 
required to participate in the provision of approved 
programmes of education or further education; and 

(ii) 

evidence that he or she has the requisite knowledge and 
skill for this purpose. 

(d) details of the applicant’s registration history and professional 

experience, if applicable; 

(e) 

details of the applicant’s current employment status. Where the 
applicant is employed, to include, details of the veterinary 

 
 
 
 8 [281] 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

(i) 

(j) 

(k) 

(l) 

nurse’s employment in a registered veterinary premises, State 
premises or an exempted premises; 

a completed declaration as to English or Irish language 
competency if required by regulation 14; 

a completed fit and proper person declaration in accordance 
with regulation 16; 

a completed declaration that the veterinary nurse will adhere to 
the standards for veterinary nurses as may be published from 
time to time by the Council in the Code of Professional 
Conduct; 

a completed declaration in accordance with the indemnity 
regulations; 

a completed declaration that the veterinary nurse will adhere to 
the continuing veterinary education regulations; 

a completed declaration that the veterinary nurse will adhere to 
the premises accreditation regulations; 

a completed declaration that the veterinary nurse will uphold 
the honour, dignity and integrity of the veterinary profession, 
and promote the welfare of animals entrusted to his or her care 
and abide by the rulings of the Veterinary Council; and 

(m) any further information or documentation requested by the 

Council.

title: ARRANGEMENT OF REGULATIONS
heading: 13. An application form for registration in a part of the register shall be
text_raw:
13. An application form for registration in a part of the register shall be 
completed in full and dated by the applicant, and the applicant shall pay the 
fee prescribed in the Council’s fees regulations. 

Language competence
text_norm: 13 application form registration part register shall completed full dated applicant applicant shall pay fee prescribed council fee regulation language competence

title: ARRANGEMENT OF REGULATIONS
heading: 14. (1) An applicant must complete a declaration as to English or Irish
text_raw:
14. (1) An applicant must complete a declaration as to English or Irish 
language competency in such form as may be prescribed by the Council from 
time to time. 

(2) An applicant shall not be registered in the register unless he or she 
provides, on request, acceptable evidence of language competence as 
determined by the Council from time to time and set out on the Council’s 
website. 

(3) This section does not apply to eligible persons entitled to be registered 

under section 95(1). 

Temporary and Occasional Services-Registration in Part C of the register
text_norm: 14 (1) applicant must complete declaration english irish language competency form may prescribed council time time (2) applicant shall registered register unless provides request acceptable evidence language competence determined council time time set council website (3) section apply eligible person entitled registered section 95(1) temporary occasional services-registration part c register

title: ARRANGEMENT OF REGULATIONS
heading: 15. An application for registration in the register shall be made in such
text_raw:
15. An application for registration in the register shall be made in such 
manner and form as may be published by the Council from time to time, in 
accordance with the requirements of the regulations of 2017. 

Part 4 

Common Provisions for registration in Parts A and D of the register, 
Retention on the register and Removal of name from the register 

Fit and Proper Declaration

title: ARRANGEMENT OF REGULATIONS
heading: 16. (1) An applicant must complete a declaration to the effect that he or
text_raw:
16. (1) An applicant must complete a declaration to the effect that he or 
she is a fit and proper person to engage in the practice of veterinary nursing in 
the State, in such form as may be prescribed by the Council from time to 
time. Such form shall include declarations that the applicant: 

(a) 

is of good character and repute and is not an undischarged 
bankrupt; 

(b) has not been convicted by a court in the State or elsewhere, of 
an offence that, in the opinion of the Council, is such to render 
the person unfit to practise veterinary nursing; 

(c) 

(d) 

is not aware of any prosecution(s) or disciplinary action 
pending in the State or in any other jurisdiction; and 

is not prohibited from practising or suspended from the 
practice of, veterinary nursing either under Part 7 of the Act or 
provisions corresponding to those contained in that Part in 
force in another state, by reason of a conviction for an offence, 

 
 
 
 
 
 10 [281] 

or serious misconduct in connection with the carrying out of 
professional duties as a veterinary nurse. 

(2) An applicant must provide such further information in relation to issues 
raised in the declaration referred to in paragraph (1) as may be requested by 
the Council. 

Part 5 

Annual retention of registration in register 

Requirement to apply for retention of registration
text_norm: 16 (1) applicant must complete declaration effect fit proper person engage practice veterinary nursing state form may prescribed council time time form shall include declaration applicant (a) good character repute undischarged bankrupt (b) convicted court state elsewhere offence opinion council render person unfit practise veterinary nursing (c) (d) aware prosecution(s) disciplinary action pending state jurisdiction prohibited practising suspended practice veterinary nursing either part 7 act provision corresponding contained part force another state reason conviction offence 10 281 serious misconduct connection carrying professional duty veterinary nurse (2) applicant must provide information relation issue raised declaration referred paragraph (1) may requested council part 5 annual retention registration register requirement apply retention registration

title: ARRANGEMENT OF REGULATIONS
heading: 17. A registered person other than a person registered in Part C of the
text_raw:
17. A registered person other than a person registered in Part C of the 
register, shall on or before 31 December each year, apply for retention of his 
or her name in the register for the following year by: 

(a) paying the fee prescribed in the Council’s fees regulations; 

(b) 

applying for retention of his or her name in the register 
annually by way of the relevant retention form specified by the 
Council from time to time; 

(c) 

furnishing a completed declaration in accordance with the 
indemnity regulations.
text_norm: 17 registered person person registered part c register shall 31 december year apply retention name register following year (a) paying fee prescribed council fee regulation (b) applying retention name register annually way relevant retention form specified council time time (c) furnishing completed declaration accordance indemnity regulation

text_raw:
18. Where a registered person applies to retain his or her registration after 
31 December as set out in regulation 17, an additional fee, as may be 
prescribed by the Council in the fees regulations, may become payable.
text_norm: 18 registered person applies retain registration 31 december set regulation 17 additional fee may prescribed council fee regulation may become payable

heading: 19. The Council shall not consider an application for retention to be valid
text_raw:

without completion of the relevant form and payment of the relevant fees.

text_raw:

text_raw:

heading: 26. The Council, and any committee established by it under the Act, or
text_raw:
26. The Council, and any committee established by it under the Act, or 
the Registrar may use any of the contact details provided by any person to the 
Council in the course of an application under these regulations, for the 
purpose of providing any information or formal notification to that person, as 
the Council considers necessary, to include information or a notification in 
relation to fitness to practise matters.

title: ARRANGEMENT OF REGULATIONS
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

These regulations set out the requirements regarding the registration of 
veterinary nurses and recognition of their qualifications and annual retention. 
The regulations also set out the requirements for the removal of veterinary 
nurses from the register and the requirements for the entry of additional 
qualifications to the register. 

These regulations may be cited as the Veterinary Council of Ireland 
(Recognition of Qualifications and Registration) (Veterinary Nurses) 
Regulations 2022. 

These Regulations come into operation on the 1st July 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 14 [281]
